pullRequest.body:
A semi-ring of sets `C` (in the sense of measure theory) is a family of sets containing `∅`, stable by intersection and such that for all `s, t ∈ C`, `s \ t` is equal to a disjoint union of finitely many sets in `C`.

Co-authored-by: Peter Pfaffelhuber <p.p@stochastik.uni-freiburg.de>

Part of the formalization of the Kolmogorov Extension theorem.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

The next step is to define contents on semirings. Mathlib already has a definition [MeasureTheory.Content](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/MeasureTheory/Measure/Content.html#MeasureTheory.Content) but only for contents on compact sets.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
Does this generalization make any sense?
```lean
structure IsSetSemiring (C : Set α) [CoheytingAlgebra α] : Prop where
  bot_mem : ⊥ ∈ C
  inf_mem : ∀ s ∈ C, ∀ t ∈ C, s ⊓ t ∈ C
  diff_eq_sup :
    ∀ t ∈ C, ∀ s ∈ C, ∃ I : Finset α, ↑I ⊆ C ∧ (I : Set α).PairwiseDisjoint id ∧ t \ s = I.sup id
```

I know about that concept of semirings of sets only from measure theory, and in that context it's only for sets of sets. I don't know if your generalization to `CoheytingAlgebra` is useful for anything.
The main use would be that it would then also work for `Set (Finset X)`, but perhaps that's of no interest. Maybe @YaelDillies has opinions.

I know of no use in this direction. Although there are a lot of similar definitions that I do need, semirings of sets are pretty specific.

Btw, I'm surprised we don't have semirings of sets already!

Also if you know another use for semirings of sets in this sense (which is not the existing [SetSemiring](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Set/Semiring.html#SetSemiring)) outside of measure theory, please tell me. If that's the case then I should place the file somewhere else.

bors r+
Thanks!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7276191156/job/19825491424)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7276191156/job/19825492385)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7276191156/job/19825491902)
LGTM, thanks!

Perhaps
```suggestion
structure IsSetSemiring (C : Set (Set α)) : Prop where
```
since this is a `Prop`, and that reduces ambiguity with `_root_.SetSemiring`

Some style suggestions:
```suggestion
/-- A semi-ring of sets `C` is a family of sets containing `∅`, stable by intersection and such that
for all `s, t ∈ C`, `t \ s` is equal to a disjoint union of finitely many sets in `C`. -/
structure IsSetSemiring (C : Set (Set α)) : Prop where
  empty_mem : ∅ ∈ C
  inter_mem : ∀ s ∈ C, ∀ t ∈ C, s ∩ t ∈ C
  diff_eq_Union' : ∀ s ∈ C, ∀ t ∈ C, 
      ∃ I : Finset (Set α), ↑I ⊆ C ∧ PairwiseDisjoint (I : Set (Set α)) id ∧ t \ s = ⋃₀ I
```

I'd drop the decidability assumption, and use instead 
```
open Classical in
/-- ... -/
noncomputable def ...
```
This means that the first few proofs below setting up the API would have to start with `classical`, but once this is done you get can rid of the decidability assumption in all downstream applications.

```suggestion
finite set of sets in `C` whose union is `s \ ⋃₀ I`.
```
The sentence doesn't really make sense otherwise, as `hC.diffFinset₀ hs I hI` is not defined yet.
I'd also remove DecidableEq from here.
Would it be correct to remark that this Finset is not characterized uniquely?

I would hope the coercion gets inserted automatically?
```suggestion
    hC.diffFinset₀ hs hI ⊆ C := by
```
It isn't inserted automatically.

I am not sure that is as a grammatical sentence.
```suggestion
`diffFinset` is a special case of `diffFinset₀` where `I` is a singleton. -/
```

Same here 🤞 
```suggestion
lemma pairwiseDisjoint_diffFinset₀ (hC : IsSetSemiring C) (hs : s ∈ C) (hI : I ⊆ C) :
```
Nope.

```suggestion
    ⋃₀ I ∪ ⋃₀ hC.diffFinset₀ hs hI = s := by
```
